**Primary Purpose**: Rich library component for displaying renderable content in neat, auto-sizing columns. Part of the Rich console rendering ecosystem for terminal output formatting.

**Core Class**: 
- `Columns` (L16-171): Main class implementing column-based layout with automatic width calculation and various alignment options. Inherits from `JupyterMixin` for notebook compatibility.

**Key Methods**:
- `__init__` (L31-52): Constructor accepting renderables list and layout configuration (padding, width, expand, equal sizing, column-first ordering, right-to-left direction, alignment, title)
- `add_renderable` (L54-60): Appends new renderable content to the columns
- `__rich_console__` (L62-171): Core rendering method implementing Rich protocol, handles automatic column sizing and layout generation

**Layout Algorithms**:
- **Column-first ordering** (L90-111): Distributes items vertically first, then horizontally using 2D cell matrix
- **Left-to-right ordering** (L112-113): Standard horizontal-first distribution
- **Auto-sizing logic** (L128-142): Iteratively reduces column count until content fits within max_width constraints

**Key Dependencies**:
- `Table.grid` (L119): Uses Rich Table component for actual rendering infrastructure
- `Measurement.get` (L78): Calculates optimal widths for renderables
- `Padding.unpack` (L72): Handles spacing configuration
- `Constrain`/`Align` (L153, L160): Applied for equal sizing and alignment

**Architecture Decisions**:
- Lazy rendering via generator pattern (yield table at L171)
- Two-pass sizing: first calculates optimal column count, then renders
- Flexible renderable input (strings auto-converted via console.render_str)
- Padding handled by delegating to Table.grid infrastructure

**Critical Constraints**:
- Column count dynamically adjusted based on available width vs content requirements
- Equal sizing forces all columns to width of largest item
- Right-to-left reverses row order after layout calculation
- Empty renderable list returns immediately (L70-71)
